intro: Vitmannia, commonly known as the marsh hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Malvaceae family. Vitmannia species often thrive in moist, swampy or wetland habitats, and they have adapted to tolerate waterlogged soils. Their leaves are usually alternate, ovate, and have a rough or hairy texture.
